medzoo.common.losses3D.BaseClass module¶

medzoo.common.losses3D.ContrastiveLoss module¶

class medzoo.common.losses3D.ContrastiveLoss.ContrastiveLoss(delta_var=0.5, delta_dist=1.5, norm='fro', alpha=1.0, beta=1.0, gamma=0.001)[source]¶

Bases: torch.nn.modules.module.Module

Implementation of contrastive loss defined in https://arxiv.org/pdf/1708.02551.pdf ‘Semantic Instance Segmentation with a Discriminative Loss Function’

forward(input, target)[source]¶
Parameters

  • input (torch.tensor) – embeddings predicted by the network (NxExDxHxW) (E - embedding dims)

  • target (torch.tensor) – ground truth instance segmentation (NxDxHxW)

Returns

alpha * variance_term + beta * distance_term + gamma * regularization_term

Return type

Combined loss defined as

training: bool¶

medzoo.common.losses3D.VAEloss module¶

medzoo.common.losses3D.VAEloss.loss_vae(recon_x, x, mu, logvar, type='BCE', h1=0.1, h2=0.1)[source]¶

see Appendix B from VAE paper: Kingma and Welling. Auto-Encoding Variational Bayes. ICLR, 2014 # https://arxiv.org/abs/1312.6114 # 0.5 * sum(1 + log(sigma^2) - mu^2 - sigma^2)

Parameters

  • recon_x –

  • x –

  • mu – VAE parameters

  • logvar – VAE parameters

  • type – choices BCE,L1,L2

  • h1 – reconsrtruction hyperparam

  • h2 – KL div hyperparam

Returns

total loss of VAE

medzoo.common.losses3D.basic module¶

medzoo.common.losses3D.basic.compute_per_channel_dice(input, target, epsilon=1e-06, weight=None)[source]¶

Computes DiceCoefficient as defined in https://arxiv.org/abs/1606.04797 given a multi channel input and target. Assumes the input is a normalized probability, e.g. a result of Sigmoid or Softmax function.

Parameters

  • input (torch.Tensor) – NxCxSpatial input tensor

  • target (torch.Tensor) – NxCxSpatial target tensor

  • epsilon (float) – prevents division by zero

  • weight (torch.Tensor) – Cx1 tensor of weight per channel/class

medzoo.common.losses3D.basic.expand_as_one_hot(input, C, ignore_index=None)[source]¶

Converts NxDxHxW label image to NxCxDxHxW, where each label gets converted to its corresponding one-hot vector

Parameters

  • input – 4D input image (NxDxHxW)

  • C – number of channels/labels

  • ignore_index – ignore index to be kept during the expansion

Returns

5D output image (NxCxDxHxW)

medzoo.common.losses3D.basic.flatten(tensor)[source]¶

Flattens a given tensor such that the channel axis is first. The shapes are transformed as follows:

(N, C, D, H, W) -> (C, N * D * H * W)

medzoo.common.losses3D.dice module¶

class medzoo.common.losses3D.dice.DiceLoss(classes=4, skip_index_after=None, weight=None, sigmoid_normalization=True)[source]¶

Bases: medzoo.common.losses3D.BaseClass._AbstractDiceLoss

Computes Dice Loss according to https://arxiv.org/abs/1606.04797. For multi-class segmentation weight parameter can be used to assign different weights per class.

  • target –

training: bool¶
medzoo.common.losses3D.tags_angular_loss.square_angular_loss(input, target, weights=None)[source]¶

Computes square angular loss between input and target directions. Makes sure that the input and target directions are normalized so that torch.acos would not produce NaNs.

Parameters

  • input – 5D input tensor (NCDHW)

  • target – 5D target tensor (NCDHW)

  • weights – 3D weight tensor in order to balance different instance sizes

Returns

per pixel weighted sum of squared angular losses3D
